values:
if you wanna keep in touch see the end of the last entry.  if not, peace and good luck.

-me

Some online comics from when the show was running courtesy of the BBC: http://www.bbc.co.uk/cult/buffy/ecomics/

Also for those who don't know Season 8 of Buffy and Season 6 of Angel are available as comics in stores.  Continuing on from where the tv series left off.

Finally, Ripper (a old school ghost story like show based on the character Giles from Buffy) is apparently back in talks. Joss mentioned that it has been green lighted at the SD Comic Con last year.  It's tentatively scheduled for a 2009 release though it isn't certain if it would be a series, tv movie, or straight to dvd movie. 

Keep your fingers crossed.

I *can not* wait!!!!

http://community.tvguide.com/blog-entry/TVGuide-News-Blog/Todays-News/Sarah-Michelle-Gellar/800032491

So it's not the return of the show itself I don't think, but still when that many people involved get together things tend to happen...

Edit:  I believe this is a movie, but maybe it will develop into a show.  From Joss' mouth:

Goners: 

"A fantasy thriller about a modern day girl who goes on a really strange ride," said Joss Whedon. "It's about a girl named Mia, people know that, who sort of sees in a mystical way the underbelly of the city and of human society, and goes through a kind of extraordinary hell, and we all have a lot of fun in the process. ...This is much more a story about -- literally about human connection and whether or not it's possible. ... But it's told on a very mystical scale and, in a way like everything I've tried to do including Buffy, it's an antidote to that very kind of film, the horror movie with the expendable human beings in it. Because I don't believe any human beings are."

And on a final note James Marsters in playing Picollo in the upcoming Dragon Ball Z movie. I caught him on Smallville the other night - he sounded so much not like Spike that it threw me for a loop.  Unfortunately I haven't really caught anything of his presence on Smallville but I don't watch the show so ~shrug~.

Screenings for the movie Juno this week and beyond all around the country. Check your city so see if it's playing there and click on the RSVP link. Fill out the form, in your email will arive passes. I'm going to the La Jolla showing on Wednesday. Gotta love free movie passes, this will be my forth one this year, though I missed a couple. Enjoy :)

The Center is so proud of our community, of our allies and of a City Council courageous and committed enough to cast the votes and make a stand for fairness and equality and against hate and discrimination. We are particularly proud of our own Councilmember Toni Atkins, who bravely and tenaciously led this momentous effort. 
Yesterday, our community again made history, as the San Diego City Council supported marriage equality by voting to sign on to the amicus briefs in the marriage equality case currently before the California Supreme Court. 

The Councilmembers who voted "yes," on the same measure on Sept. 4 (Scott Peters, Toni Atkins, Jim Madaffer and Ben Hueso), were joined by Councilmember Donna Frye, resulting in a 5-3 victory. This means that San Diego could join other California cities like Los Angeles, San Francisco, Oakland, San Jose and Long Beach in supporting this case by signing a friend-of-the-court (amicus) brief. 

The future of this item is now in the hands of San Diego Mayor Jerry Sanders. We know the Mayor has heard from our community, and we believe him to be a courageous leader who will do the right thing and make this decision with fairness and integrity. Please e-mail Mayor Sanders and thank him for his past support of civil rights issues and encourage him to stand with us again on this important issue of equality. The Mayor's e-mail address is jerrysanders@sandiego.gov.

The Center and its Public Policy Department would like to express our sincere and deep appreciation to all those who called and wrote to the members of the City Council over the past two weeks, and particularly to all those who attended the hearing at City Hall and courageously testified before the Council. Your presence, your testimony and your support made a difference. You helped make this moment in our history possible. Thank you. As always, The Center will keep you posted as to new developments.

1. interviewed at target, they loved me, i'd better get it 2. took a job doing door hangers, never got paid, can't get ahold of the guy that owes me 3. registered for school starting in august, no clue what i'm taking yet 4. saw michele today, she came down, was fun, uneventful, unmoving 5. face planted playing basketball: that is all for now.

Clearing out some people I don't ever talk to, who never post, or otherwise.  No offense and much love and luck to all. 

Also welcome to new peeps.  Get on with your bad selves.

Pretty much for my reference, but feel free to enjoy. The Prodigal Son (Yuen Woo Ping, Sammo Hung, dir: Sammo Hung) Tai Chi Master (Jet Li, Michelle Yeoh, dir: Yuen Wo Ping) Rob-B-Hood (Jackie Chan) Challenge of the Masters (shaw brothers) The Killer (Chow Yun Fat, dir: John Woo) Heroes of Shaolin (shaw brothers) Haggard (CKY, Bam, etc) Muppets Magic: From The Ed Sullivan Show ETC Hong Kong Hatchet Men Karate Frightmare The Tong Father Deadly Kung Fu Lady Queen Boxer Revenge of the Kung Fu Lady A Fistful of Yen The Chang Gang Karate Death Squad For a Few More Yen They Kill Shaolin Wooden Men (Jackie Chan) Rage of the Master Dragon Princess Tattoo Connection The Crippled Masters Chinese Hercules Blood Fight Snake and Crane Secret Karate Warriors Golden Dragon Silver Snake Dragon on Fire Blood of the Dragon Rage of the Dragon modern hong kong cinema Anna in Kung Fu Land (part 1) Anna in Kung Fu Land (part 2)

this say seems to be somersaulting back and forth between stupid and good.  got a notice from a collection company representing the place where i used to live trying to collect $640.  i had called her over a month ago telling her i needed the receipts from any work that was done as pursuant with california law, blah, blah, blah.  now i'm going to have to fight with these people again... aggravating to say the least.

i had made plans to get together with a friend down there, but i am waiting for her call still.  i really just want to get out of here and get to doing whatever i'm doing.  i hate waiting around for people, or i hate that i have no life and have to wait around for people.  probably the latter i guess. arg.

jess is officially moved out.  she still has a lot of her things here, but she has been gone for a week now.  i have been spending a lot of time with friends.  i have to admit when i spend too much time alone i get really down and my attitude tends to be more positive and productive when i'm around friends.  my gay friend brandon is probably moving in to finish out the lease here then i'll be moving from there.  so i have about three months to decide and plan what i want to do with my life.  

i'm still missing work, and there's a lot of stuff i have to do that i'm not looking forward to.  i still have a lot of anxiety when dealing with stuff that i don't want to. 

but things are getting bet and i'm at a point in my life where i can truly do anything i want and excuses would just not be viable.  i'm ready i think though.  i want to have the life i always wanted.  

the next part of the story would be more exciting.

I haven't been on here much - I've been using myspace for the most part. It's got a lot of my offline friends on there too, so it's just convenient for that. So, if you haven't already and want to keep in better touch add me at myspace. My profile is here: My super cool myspace - with slide shows, soon videos, etc

This weeks selections: Traveling Light by Joel Hanson with Sara Groves -Joel Hanson is the front man for the mostly defunct pFr. This is just a great melodic song with Sara's vocals reminiscent of another Sarah... "down by the river side, i lay my burdens down, now i'm traveling light. my spirit lifted high, i found my freedom now and i'm traveling light" The Coffee Song by Jars of Clay - a fun departure from their usual. Mexican Wrestler (live) - Jill Sobule w/Cindi Lauper -a funny sideways love song with Cindi providing background vocals. "but when we would land i might take pity on you, i can crack all your ribs, but i can't break your heart. you will never love me. and this i can't forget. that you will never love me as long as i will live." Fall Into Me - Mudvayne -for something a little heavier. this got some radio play, but the lyrics are really interesting and the song reminds me a bit of A Perfect Circle. "dreams of earthquakes, dreams of hurricanes, dreams of pouring rain, dreams of tidal waves (to wash us all away), dreams of guns blaze, dreams of fire rage, dreams of swollen graves, dreams of swollen pain, all gone. no more fallen, no more enemies, no more casualties, no more dreams" When I'm Gone - Eminem -probably my favorite of his more serious stuff. really quite a powerful song if you listen. "have you ever loved someone so much you'd give an arm for. not the expression, no, literally give an arm for. when they know they're your heart and you know you are their amour and you would destroy anyone who would try to harm her." that's it - gotta get ready for work, enjoy!

ok, myspace page up for my music. add it if you want to hear songs when i get them recorded. i was tempted to put my older crap but it just sounds awful. hehe. anyhoo: http://www.myspace.com/kiliansabremusic :)

1. Your name spelled backwards? ttocs

5. Last time you swam in a pool? Last year when it was warm. 

6. Britney Spears is a skank. Agree or disagree? haha who cares. :P 

7. How many kids do you want? probably none.

9. What was the last thing you bought? KFC yum!

10. Have you ever ridden on a bike?  of course! 
 
11. Does someone have a crush on you? i sincerely doubt it.

12. Ever made a prank phone call? haha yeah we used to do some really horrible ones.  we were pretty mean back in the day, but i'd call people up and ask "suicide hotline?" and when they'd say no i'd scream "oh god! this was my only quarter.  to hell with this world. AAAAAAAAAAAUGH!" and hang up.  i was a kid, what do you want?

17. Do you really know all the words to your national anthem? hmm i think so.

20. Favorite pizza toppings?  pepperoni

21. Chips or popcorn?  i'm a popcorn whore.


22.Who is your best friend? anders, jess, garrett, brandon, jerry
 

23. What color is your name?  um? blue i guess?

24. What did your last text message you received say? hello? still sleeping?

25. Have you ever been in a beauty pageant? hahahahahahahahahahhahahahahhahahahahahahahah.  no.


26. Orange Juice or apple?  i like apple when i'm into juice.


27. Who were the last people you went out to dinner with? probably jess i think.

28. What did the last text message that u sent say?  i was in the bathroom, be patient.  i'm in a pretty good mood today. 

29. Lucky number(s)? 7 and multiples of 7.


30. Last time you ate a homegrown tomato? hmmm sean's house maybe?   

31. Have you ever won a trophy?  yeah i won several soccer trophies  back in the day.

35. Sprite or 7-Up? hmm either way.

39. Would you rather find true love or be a millionaire?  millionaire. i stick to love being overrated

40.Do you believe in love at first sight?  not real love, but i think you can recognize a connection between you and another at first sight.
 

41. Who do you hate right now?  hate is a waste of time.  


42. Who was the last person you visited in the hospital?  brandon, when he broke his back.


43. Where will you be for spring break?  it's a little past spring break, but palm springs.

44. Last time you laughed?  about a minute ago. 


45. What's your favorite animal?  cats, dolphin (i used to love hanging at the dolphin pool at sea world)

51. What do you think of the person that posted this before you?  she's awsome!  i've got nothing but good things to say about her.


52.Who is MOST likely to repost this survey? hmm i dunno!  you?

Welcome friends old and new! This journal will be about 50% public, and 50% friends only. If that is an issue to you, don't join. Also, and this is very important: this is a DRAMA FREE zone and shall always remain that way. Absolutely no bickering here. Go join a forum for that. That said, everyone is welcome, come with an open mind.
